intro: Scrophularia frutescens var. frutescens, commonly known as common scrophularia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that range in color from pink to purple, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly serrated edge. This species is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in open woodlands.
